thread.title: Election Costs: Least of Connecticut’s Worries

author: wsjcom
title: Election Costs: Least of Connecticut’s Worries
text:
Stephen Eide describes a chaotic GOP contest in Connecticut for the party’s gubernatorial nomination (”In Connecticut, Even the Politicians Are Publicly Funded,” Cross Country, April 7) and attributes the Republican primary muddle, in part, to the state’s financing of campaigns of candidates running for state office. Absent state funding it is likely that there would be fewer than nine Republicans vying to be governor and the GOP would be more likely to rally around one strong candidate for the November election.
Nutmeg State...
